list_definition.definition: a cloth for covering a table, usually for a meal

list_ex_of_english: They are unlikely to be able to see food clearly if it is on a patterned plate that is on a patterned tablecloth.
Also, if one can pay the price one can now get tablecloths.
It applies equally to tablecloths, table-napkins, and many of the things which women use in their houses every day.

We were invited inside and, on a wooden packing case, was a white tablecloth, with the table set for tea for my wife and myself.
I always think that one of the most beautiful sights is a damask tablecloth set for dinner by candlelight.
I do not think that the beautiful tablecloths used by ordinary people ought to be regarded as any kind of excessive luxury.
It was as big as an enormous tablecloth.
